dataset.title: Dataset: Sediment carbon stocks and sequestration rates in the Pacific Northwest region of Washington, US
dataset.abstract: This data release includes carbon stocks and sequestration rates for seagrass meadows and natural and restored tidal marshes in the Pacific Northwest US. Our studies have 1) estimated organic carbon stocks and sequestration rates for a Z. marina meadow in Padilla Bay, a National Estuarine Research Reserve in Washington, 2) conducted a blue C assessment of restored and natural tidal marshes in the Stillaguamish River estuary in Puget Sound, Washington, and 3) provided an assessment of carbon stocks and sequestration rates from 12 sites across the Snohomish estuary, representing emergent tidal wetland, forested tidal wetland, regenerating emergent wetland, and drained wetland in the Pacific Northwest US. Sediment accretion and carbon accumulation rates were determined with radiometric dating.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: PVC pipe was driven into the sediment with a hammer to recover a core

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was sieved prior to analysis for organics

attribute.attributeDefinition: If sediment was sieved, the size of sieve used.
Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors observed no obvious compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were not removed before measuring organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: A regression model fit using a subset of measurements was used to predict fraction carbon as a function of fraction organic matter
No additional details were provided regarding fraction carbon methodologies

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining radiocesium activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Site identification code unique to each study.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Site description including relevant study details and political geographic units. Some of these descriptions can be automated by the ingestion code.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).

codeDefinition.definition: 0.5-35 ppt according to most definitions
Predominantly freshwater input from rivers

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity observed from local instrument.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation > 5 meters in height
Describes tidal or subtidal communities dominated by rooted vascular plants.
Describes wetlands with no or very little vegetation (such as mud flats)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation relatively high in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Inundation class assessed from elevation and nearby tide gauge or other similar method.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Maximum longitude defining a bounding box for the site in decimal degree WGS84. This can also be generated automatically by the ingestion code.
Minimum longitude defining a bounding box for the site in decimal degree WGS84. This can also be generated automatically by the ingestion code.
Maximum latitude defining a bounding box for the site in decimal degree World Geodedic System of 1984 (WGS84). This can also be generated automatically by the ingestion code.
Minimum latitude defining a bounding box for the site in decimal degree WGS84. This can also be generated automatically by the ingestion code.
Estuary associated with the site and/or core

Surface elevation of the core relative to defined datum.

The datum relative to which the core elevation was measured against (For a complete list of datum names and aliases please refer to the ISO Geodedic Registry https://iso.registry.bespire.eu/register/geodetic/VerticalDatum).

codeDefinition.definition: A gravity-based geodetic datum, North American Vertical Datum of 1988

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Estuary associated with the site and/or core
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Measured mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Modeled mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for radiocesium (137Cs).
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with excess_pb210_activity.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for lead 214 (214Pb) at 352 keV
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with pb214_activity at 352 keV.
Any other submitter generated notes specific to the depth interval.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Estuary associated with the site and/or core
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.

codeDefinition.definition: The wetland has been diked and drained, with or without flapper gates, pumping, or other means
Tidal flow has been restored by removing an artificial obstruction
